question: Ah, you're awake. Good. Tell you what - we'll make a deal. I'll tell you what I know, then you tell me what you know. O.K.? O.K.?
answer: Where am I?

question: You're in the Malahide Institute. It's a psychiatric hospital. But, hey, don't feel judged - it was just the nearest place to bring you. Remember? You and your boyfriend... ?
answer: Steve...

question: Don't worry. He's O.K. We sent him home hours ago. Jeez, what a story. What was it, kid? Smack? Angel dust? Don't tell me acid's back in fashion?
answer: What are you talking about? Who are you?

question: Oh, excuse me... Ronson. Homicide. I'm this district's slash and dash expert. Made a career of the nasty ones. That's why I was at your Dad's house. Jesus, what a mess. We got two missing people and a house full of corpses. Talk to me.
answer: I thought Steve had talked to you?

question: Oh, pardon me. I obviously didn't convey my hesitation to take his story at face-value. No, YOU talk to me. But - do me a favor? - none of this DEMONS crap.
answer: He talked about Demons, huh?

question: Yeah.
answer: It's true. All of it. It's all true.

question: Hi, Kyle.
answer: Now, Kirsty...

question: The cop. He didn't believe me.
answer: I suspect not. But that doesn't necessarily mean you're wrong, does it?

question: Do you believe me?
answer: Well, I don't know yet. However, you're not lying. YOU believe this is the truth.

question: It IS the truth.
answer: Well?

question: Oh, Jesus, I'm sorry. God, if anyone should know not to do that, it's me. I'm sorry. O.K.? Sad, huh? She's been here six months. Her name's TIFFANY.
answer: What's the matter with her?

question: Almost complete withdrawal. She hasn't said a word for nearly two years.
answer: God, that's terrible.

question: Yeah. Doctor Malahide's got her doing these jig-saws and things, though. Says it's helping to bring her out. Anyway, let's concentrate on you for a moment. Wanna suck on this for me?
answer: Hey, good joke, Kyle. Do you always come on to the mentally ill?

question: Shit. Sorry. Here's the pills. Red face. Door. Bye.
answer: Jesus, I'm glad I'm not paying for this place. Daddy...

question: I...I had a visitor.
answer: What?

question: Oh, Jesus. I can't explain. It's ...it's. I don't know how to help! I have to save him and I don't know how to help!
answer: Kirsty, I'm sorry... don't understand. I...

question: I know. No-one can. But I have to save him. Where's the other doctor? He said He'd listen. He promised.
answer: Dr. Malahide. Yes. Look, I'll fetch him. You take it easy. I'm sure he can help.

question: Help. No, no-one can help. I just want someone to listen or I WILL go crazy.
answer: If anyone can help, HE can.

question: I'm cold. Well?
answer: Yes... Yes. You look...

question: Surreal? Strange? Nightmarish?
answer: No. You look...

question: Yes, I still like WINE ... ... and more. Close it.
answer: It's a beautiful dress...

question: I know.
answer: There... Well?

question: Yeah?
answer: You O.K.? Kirsty? You 0. K.?

question: No bad dreams.
answer: So you slept O.K.?

question: As much as that bed of nails allowed.
answer: Well, the sofa isn't often used for sleeping on...

question: Oh yeah? On your own a lot, Huh?
answer: Like the robe? I think I need to talk. About what I saw.

question: You thought I was crazy, didn't you?
answer: Jesus, yes! What do you expect. I mean, God, I still do! It's just that now I'm crazy too.

question: And you're sure it was a woman?
answer: God, I wish I could say no. This is going to do terrible things to my attitude, you know.

question: Don't worry about it. Your attitude sucks anyway.
answer: Hey, so for it. Don't let pity stop you. I'm down. Nail me.

question: What can I do? How can I save him? The box. I need the box.
answer: The box? Like in your story? Like in his house?

question: What?
answer: The Boxes. In the House. I told you.

question: What do you mean?
answer: The boxes! I TOLD you.

question: You DIDN'T tell me. Do you mean Malahide's got...
answer: Yeah. The things you were talking about.

question: I'm going.
answer: Wait a minute. What do you mean, 'I'm going?' TO the HOUSE?

question: Get out of the way.
answer: Are you crazy?

question: I don't know, Kyle. You're the fucking expert. Now get out of the way!
answer: WHY?

question: Because I'm going to get my father! I'm going to get my father.
answer: Two seconds. Just two seconds. Don't move. O.K. Let's go.

question: Kyle, you don't have...
answer: I KNOW I don't have to. It's just my time of the month to be a complete fucking idiot. O.K.? Wait! The .. thing ... I want to be sure it's not here.

question: I KNOW I don't have to. It's just my time of the month to be a complete fucking idiot. O.K.? Wait! The .. thing ... I want to be sure it's not here.
answer: Sssh. I think it's still here.

question: What? The...The thing?
answer: Yes. I had to stop you going in there because I knew you'd cry out. Any normal person would. It ...It's just TERRIBLE.

question: Is it in there?
answer: No. Not now. Was I right? Is it terrible?

question: Yes. Yes, it's terrible.
answer: Oh. You look awful. You poor boy. Come here... ...Come to Mother ... What's your name?

question: Kyle...
answer: I'm JULIA. Thank you, Kyle.

question: I'm JULIA. Thank you, Kyle.
answer: Kyle...? Kyle?

question: Kirsty! How nice of you to drop in. You have surprisingly good taste in men.
answer: Kyle! No! I'll kill you, you...

question: Oh, you can try it, you little bitch. I'd love you to try it. But I'm not just the woman I was.
answer: What, you mean you're something more than a whore with a vicious streak?

question: I mean I'm something more than human, you little shit! Oh, Kirsty. They didn't tell you, did they? I'm afraid they've changed the rules of the fairy tale; I'm no longer just the wicked step-mother. Now I'm the Evil Queen. So come on; Take your best shot, Snow White.
answer: Julia!

question: You're sure this is what you want?
answer: It's what I've ALWAYS wanted. A view of ... beyond. You were almost enough, Julia but...I have to see. I have to

question: Oh, I quite understand.
answer: She's done it.

question: She certainly has.
answer: It's coming.

question: But I didn't open it! I didn't!
answer: Then why are you here?

question: I've come for my father!
answer: But he's in his own Hell, child And quite unreachable.

question: I don't believe you!
answer: But it's true, He is his own Hell. Just as you are in yours.

question: And what about you?
answer: It's different for us.

question: Daddy...? Tiffany. Wait here. If I'm not back real soon - get out. Get home. daddy... Daddy. It's Kirsty... Oh God. Daddy... ?
answer: That's it, baby. Come to Daddy.

question: NO!
answer: What's the matter, Kirsty? It's only Frank. It's only Uncle Frank.

question: I should have known! I should've known he wouldn't be here! This place is only for filth like you!
answer: Oh, right. Daddy's died and gone to heaven, eh?

question: Yes!
answer: Shit. Bull. Shit See? He's here. You should learn to believe your Uncle Frank.

question: No! He SHOULDN'T be here! It SHOULD'VE been a trick!
answer: 'Fraid not, baby. He belongs here. With me. We're the same. Brothers. Equal and opposite. Pure appetite. Pure banality. Too much feeling. None at all.

question: You're full of shit, Frank Cotton. My Dad wasn't like that at all. He could feel. He could love. He loved ME. He...he loved me.
answer: Don't waste your tears. Look at him!

question: He loved me, you bastard! He Loved me, he loved my mother. He even loved that bitch you betrayed him with!
answer: Ah, Julia. She hasn't been to see me recently. That's why it's so nice to have you here, baby. Daddy's little girl. So pretty when she's upset. Come to Daddy, Now don't be naughty, Kirsty. Or I'll have to punish you first. Perhaps you'd like that. Would you like that?

question: Daddy! Daddy! I love you! Help me!
answer: I'm your Daddy now, Kirsty.

question: Yes. Stay there. I'll be with you in a minute.
answer: Frank... Well, well. All my family together again. How very sweet.

question: Julia.
answer: Frank.

question: I knew you'd come.
answer: You knew?

question: Yes. You're a girl who remembers her promises.
answer: Oh, I do. I do.

question: My God, it's her room!
answer: Let's go!

question: No. No, there's something wrong...
answer: Jesus. O.K. No more arguments. Just RUN! Go. Go. Go. Go. Go!!

question: Tiffany ... ? But these were ... Daddy? These flowers. I saw them just... ...the day ...before... yesterday Daddy? Daddy! Daddy! Get help. Pass me a pillow. What do you do? I just don't know what to do.
answer: Coronary arrest. Let's be quick.

question: Is he going to be 0.K.?
answer: We just can't say. O.R.'s on standby. They'll do what they can.

question: But it's bad?
answer: Yeah. It's bad. Wait out here. A doctor will talk to you when we know more.

question: Time to play.
answer: Wait!

question: No more deals, Kirsty. It's your flesh we want to experience, not your skill at bargaining.
answer: No deals! Just information. Information. Free of charge. No strings. Just information.

question: Go on. But trick us again, child, and your suffering will be legendary even in Hell. What is this? Someone else you think escaped us, like Frank?
answer: No, No, this one didn't escape. You told me you'd always been in Hell. You were wrong. Look at it. LOOK. IT'S YOU.

question: Nonsense, I...
answer: It's you! You HAVEN'T always been as you are. You were HUMAN. Remember. Remember all your confusions. Think!

question: I have to go back. Or it'll never stop.
answer: What are you talking...

question: I've got to finish it.
answer: Finish what? Tiffany! Wait! Oh, gross. What are you doing? What are WE doing?

question: I can't do it here. I have to go to it. I'm scared.
answer: No. Don't let it. You've come this far.
